item.title: Boot from NVMe drive on an unsupported motherboard (UEFI only) ((draft, needs polishing))
item.description: If your motherboard does not support booting from a PCIe slot, But you’ve got one of those “nvme to pcie x1 adapter” and are surprised that it doesn’t work Well, consider yourself lucky! (If your motherboard has UEFI that is) Since we can use a small workaround to chainload the bootloader/kernel on the pcie slot drive using a uefi bootloader on another boot drive that is supported (such as a sata hdd).
